text.p: These are the leading stories in the Algerian press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Obsessive fear grips Algiers and surrounding towns after rash of bombings.
- Privatisation council proposes change in the privatisation law to allow workers to buy shares.
- Prime Minister Ahmed Ouyahia urges more efforts to keep economic reforms on track.
- University students resume courses after teachers' strike over pay.
- The government forecasts five percent rise in Gross Domestic Product in 1997, up one percentage point compared to 1996.
